class.title: iOS
class.description: At the end you'll have a running example code and a working development environment.

introduction.paragraph: This section shows you how to download and build a sample app named Todo Lite. Todo Lite is a shared to-do list app that demonstrates many Couchbase Lite features and is implemented for all our platforms.
Before you can build the ToDo Lite app, make sure you have the following tools installed on your computer. You might already have some of them installed.

body.paragraph: Download Couchbase Lite for iOS and move it to a permanent location.
If you don't already have it, download and install Git.

lesson.title: Building Todo Lite
lesson.description: Get the example up and running locally

introduction.paragraph: Todo Lite is an example app for collaborative task list management. It illustrates many of the Couchbase Lite features, including document CRUD, binary attachments, view queries, authentication, and sync. Once you have it up and running you can read the source code to see examples of using Couchbase Lite in action.

body.paragraph: Terminal is usually located in the Applications/Utilities folder.
Change to the directory that you want to store the ToDo Lite app in. For example:

list-item.paragraph: In the downloaded Couchbase Lite for iOS folder, find the CouchbaseLite.framework folder.
Copy the CouchbaseLite.framework folder to the Frameworks folder inside the ToDoLite-iOS folder.

ordered-list.list-item: Double click the ToDoLite.xcodeproj project to open in Xcode.

list-item.paragraph: In Xcode, select an iOS simulator build scheme.
The ToDo Lite app opens in the iOS simulator.
